#summary The android client that manages the IOIO.

= Android Client =

The Android Client is a heavily threaded application designed to interact with a connected IOIO, receive commands from bluetooth Zeemotes or a connected server, and act upon them or forward them to the IOIO.

[http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/ AndroThumper] can be driven around and controlled without an internet connection by connecting two Zeemotes. <screenshot> Each Zeemote then commands each side of motors with the joysticks.

== Managers ==

To manage the multiple threads and drivers in [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/ AndroThumper] there is the concept of [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Managers Managers]. Each manager is responsible for holding instances of each of the objects it is managing, such as the [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Managers_Thread ThreadManager] holds the [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Thread_Camera camera thread], and the [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Managers_Drivers DriverManager] holds the WaypointDriver. The [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Managers Managers] provide a way for the Threads to call each others methods. The [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Managers_Drivers DriverManager] has an instance of the [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Managers_Thread ThreadManager], and allows the drivers to control the threads, for example, allowing the WaypointDriver to control the [http://code.google.com/p/androthumper/wiki/Android_Client_Thread_IOIO IOIO Thread].
